page.title: 11HARTLIP MANORS
page.content: The countryside around Hartlip held in the past, three manors-Yaugher,Hartlip & Grayney.From these manors remain two impressive manor houses.{Yaugher}had the manor house Queendown Warren.This was built in 1560 using oak bought from Henry 8th.In 1841 the owner chose to move the house to a new site.The local wagoner & his men took down the house and moved it a few miles to its present location on Queendown Warren alongside the nature reserve.The house which is a listed building is a lovely Tudor Manor.The interior contains maps charters & artefacts dating back many centuries.{Hartlip Place Manor}was built in 1809 replacing a former one built 500 years earlier,which had fallen into disrepair.The gardens are opened at certain times in summer.
